Interface ResourceHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
FileSystemResourceHandler
public interface ResourceHandler
Defines an abstraction layer for resource (CSS, images) management. Resources are defined by means of abstract implementation-dependent paths represented by plain Strings. Responsibility for closing of all resources acquired from this interface rests with the caller.
Author:
Ibrahim Chaehoi, Stanislaw Osinski

  • Method Details

    • getResourceAsInputStream

      InputStream getResourceAsInputStream(String path) throws IOException
      Returns the resource input stream for the provided path.
      Parameters:
      path - the resource path
      Returns:
      the resource stream or null if the resource could not be opened.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

    • getResourceAsReader

      Reader getResourceAsReader(String path) throws IOException
      Returns the reader for the provided path. Implementations are responsible for creating the reader with the right charset.
      Parameters:
      path - the resource path
      Returns:
      the reader or null if the resource could not be opened.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

    • getResourceAsOutputStream

      OutputStream getResourceAsOutputStream(String path) throws IOException
      Returns the resource output stream for the provided path. If the resource already exists, its content should be overwritten.
      Parameters:
      path - the resource path
      Returns:
      the resource stream or null if the resource could not be opened.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

    • getResourceAsWriter

      Writer getResourceAsWriter(String path) throws IOException
      Returns the writer for the provided path. If the resource already exists, its content should be overwritten. Implementations are responsible for creating the writer with the right charset.
      Parameters:
      path - the resource path
      Returns:
      the writer or null if the resource could not be opened.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

    • getResourcePath

      String getResourcePath(String cssFilePath, String cssRelativePath)
      Builds a resource path relative to a CSS file resource path.
      Parameters:
      cssFilePath - the CSS file path (base)
      cssRelativePath - the relative path to be resolved against the cssFilePath. If the resource path starts with the '/' character, it is an absolute resource and should be resolved against the SmartSpritesParameters.getDocumentRootDir() path instead. All other resource paths should be assumed to be relative to the cssFilePath.
      Returns:
      the combined resource path
